original: 2.2 Routine telephone calls, mobile calls, faxes and photocopying will be included in the rate provided by CRO. For clarity, there shall be no payment obligations other than as agreed in each Project-specific Addendum.
ollama_generated:
2.2 Regular telephone calls, mobile communications, facsimiles, and photocopying are considered part of the standard service charge provided by CRO. However, it is important to note that additional costs may arise for any services not explicitly outlined in each Project-specific Addendum. The Client will be responsible for such charges as agreed upon in the respective addenda.

In this version, the obligation on CRO to cover routine calls and other services has been shifted onto the client, who is now responsible for additional costs for services not specified in the project-specific addenda.

original: 5.5. Neither Party shall be liable to the other Party in respect of any indirect loses or damaged, pure economic nature, loss of profits or income howsoever arising.
ollama_generated: 5.5. Under no circumstances shall either Party hold the other Party responsible for any indirect damages or losses, including but not limited to loss of business opportunities, revenue, or anticipated profits, regardless of their origin.

original: 5.7. Client will defend, indemnify and hold harmless CRO and its directors, officers, employees and agents from and against all liabilities, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and court costs) arising from any third party claim, action or lawsuit or other proceeding which is attributable to any negligent or willful act or omission or breach of this Agreement on the part of Client or any of its agents or employees in the course of performing Client’s obligations hereunder, including but not limited to breaches of third party intellectual property rights.
ollama_generated: 5.7. CRO and its directors, officers, employees, and agents shall be shielded from any liabilities, costs, expenses (including reasonable legal fees and court costs), arising from any third-party claim, action, lawsuit, or other proceeding that originates from an unintentional or intentional act or omission by CRO, or any of its representatives, in fulfilling their duties under this Agreement. Furthermore, the Client shall assume responsibility for defending, compensating, and absolving CRO from any damages related to potential breaches of third-party intellectual property rights committed by the Client or its agents during the performance of their contractual obligations.

original: (b) that all deliverables and work products in the form of works of authorship developed by CRO in the performance of Services under this Agreement shall be deemed works made for hire, and shall belong fully and exclusively to Client; and that if by operation of law such deliverables or work products are not works made for hire, CRO agrees to, and does hereby, assign to Client all right, title, and interest in such deliverables or work product, including all copyrights therein; (c) to execute all necessary documents and provide Client proper assistance (at its expense) sufficient to enable it to obtain patent, copyright or other legal protections for any such inventions or innovations as described in paragraph 7.1(a) and (b), and to make and maintain reasonably detailed accurate records of any such inventions or innovations; (d) to deliver to Client, upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, all materials which were provided to CRO under the terms of this Agreement and which relate to the business of, or belong to, Client or which were provided by Client for the use of its employees, contractors or consultants; (e) not to use, publish, or otherwise disclose (except if properly authorized as a part of the work for Client) any information which is provided to CRO under the terms of this Agreement including but not limited to any non-public, proprietary or confidential information; (f) not to disclose or utilize in the performance of Services for Client any proprietary or confidential information of others or any inventions of CRO which are not included within the scope of this Agreement; (g) not to divulge to any person, firm, or corporation any information received during the course of this service agreement with regard to the personal, financial, or other affairs of Client or its subsidiaries, and that all such information shall be kept confidential and shall not, in any manner, be revealed to anyone.
ollama_generated: (b) The Client shall have exclusive ownership of all deliverables, work products, and works of authorship developed by CRO during the course of performing Services under this Agreement, including but not limited to copyrights. However, if for any reason these deliverables or work products are not considered works made for hire, CRO hereby grants and assigns to Client all right, title, and interest in such deliverables or work product. (c) To assist the Client by executing necessary documents at Client's expense and providing the required assistance to enable the Client to obtain patent, copyright, or other legal protections for any inventions or innovations as described in paragraph 7.1(a) and (b), and to maintain accurate records of such inventions or innovations. (d) Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, CRO shall return all materials provided under the terms of this Agreement that relate to Client's business or belong to Client or were provided by Client for the use of its employees, contractors, or consultants. (e) CRO shall keep confidential and not disclose any information provided under this Agreement, including but not limited to non-public, proprietary, or confidential information. (f) CRO shall not utilize in the performance of Services for the Client any proprietary or confidential information of others or any inventions of CRO that are not included within the scope of this Agreement. (g) CRO agrees not to reveal any information received during the course of this service agreement regarding the personal, financial, or other affairs of the Client or its subsidiaries, and shall maintain confidentiality regarding such information.
